sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The setpriority procedure is used to set the priority of a process in a concurrent program. This priority cannot be counted on to guarantee critical access to shared variables. A smaller value of p means increased speed. The argument to setpriority may be limited to the range 0 to 2**15 - 1.
sections.text_content: The setpriority procedure is used to set the priority of a process in a concurrent program. This priority cannot  be counted on to guarantee critical access to shared variables. A smaller value of p means increased speed. The argument to setpriority may be limited to the range 0 to 2**15 - 1.
sections.mdown_content: The **setpriority** procedure is used to set the priority of a process in a concurrent program. This priority cannot  be counted on to guarantee critical access to shared variables. A smaller value of *p* means increased speed. The argument to **setpriority** may be limited to the range 0 to 2**15 - 1.

sections.raw_content:
getpriority, fork and monitor.
